SlickSpec pre-release

Generic Selectors API Specification

SlickSpec is a framework independant specification for selectors engines.

In this first release all the various separate specs have been combined into a single spec runner. Some of the frameworks specifically choose not to support some selectors that other frameworks fully support. In our next SlickSpec release we plan to separate out these selectors and have both a strict standards-only set and a common extenstions set of specs.

Bootstrapped

→ SlickSpec Sizzle edge
→ SlickSpec Sizzle jQuery 1.4
→ SlickSpec Sizzle jQuery 1.3
→ SlickSpec MooTools Slick edge
→ SlickSpec MooTools 1.2.4
→ SlickSpec NWSAPI 20091231
→ SlickSpec YUI 2.x

SlickSpec for any engine

To run SlickSpec on your own selector engine all you need is a link to the source and a simple bootstrap script.

The bootstrap script maps the generic methods that the specs use to the specific selector engine's methods.

See the Slick.js bootstrap as an example bootstrap/slick.slickspec.js.

Run against a custom script

Known Issues

  • Sometimes specs run multiple times and result in a % higher than 100%
    This isn't that big of a deal since the result of each spec should remain the same no matter how many times it is run
  • Some specs are currently commented out
    We're working on supporting those additional specs in an upcoming version.
  • Tons of specs fail, but only sometimes
    Sometimes specs fail simple because they haven't fully loaded before the runner tried to run them. This is on our TODO to get fixed. Currently we use SlickSpec mostly on our localhost. Try waiting until everyhing fully loads and then refreshing the runner.

Roadmap

  • SlickSpec Pre-release (current)
    Get it done enough to be useful for selector engine developers.
  • SlickSpec 1.0 (next)
    1. Switch from JSSpec to another JavaScript testing library.
      Probly Jasmine, but that is subject to change.
    2. Separate out all the specs into separate groups
      • W3C CSS 1
      • W3C CSS 2.1
      • W3C CSS 3
      • W3C CSS Draft
      • Library-specific Extensions
        • jQuery's :first
        • SlickJS's reverse combinators
        • etc…
      • etc…
  • SlickSpec 2.0 (eventually)
    • ServerSide JS support
      • Env.js
      • Jaxer
      • JScript.NET ActiveX "htmlfile"
      • etc…
    • Support multiple testing frameworks?
    • Store results and generate reports?
    • More integration with TestSwarm?
    • Bootstraps/Wrappers to map any selector engine's api to any other selector engine's api?
    • Other crazy awesome stuff!
Help develop SlickSpec on GitHub
Please report any issues with SlickSpec to SlickSpec Issues
